description: Retrieve structured information from a patient’s GP practice record.
name: gp-connect-access-record-structured-fhir-api
related_standards:
This standard relates to the following APIs:
* [GP Connect Access Document - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/gp-connect-access-document-fhir) – use this API to retrieve unstructured documents from a patient’s GP practice record
* [Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir) – use this API to search for patients, retrieve patients by NHS number and update patients
* [Personal Demographics Service - HL7 V3 API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-hl7-v3) – use this if you want to use functions that are not yet available on the FHIR API
* [Spine Directory Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/spine-directory-service-fhir) – access accredited system information and messaging endpoint details
title: GP Connect Access Record: Structured - FHIR API

dependencies:
To use this API, you will need the patient's NHS number, which can be retrieved by using the following API:

Personal Demographics Service (FHIR) API - use this API to search for patients and retrieve their details. This API can also be used to update their details in some cases.
description: Access the Reasonable Adjustment Flag - a national record which indicates that a patient requires reasonable adjustments and includes relevant details.
name: reasonable-adjustment-flag-fhir-api
related_standards:
When using this API, we also recommend that you consider using these related APIs:

Female Genital Mutilation Information Sharing System (FGM-IS) - use this API to store and share FGM information of children under 18 with relevant NHS healthcare professionals across departments, organisations and geographical boundaries within England.

Child Protection Information Sharing (CP-IS) - HL7 V3 API - use this API to provide access to CP-IS, a sharing system which provides healthcare workers with access to recent unscheduled care attendance information for children under a local authority social care plan.

National Record Locator (NRL) (FHIR) API - use this API to locate and share patient records held within local health and social care systems.
title: Reasonable Adjustment Flag - FHIR API

description: Receive notifications about changes to a patient's demographic details, including birth, death, change of address and change of GP.
name: personal-demographics-service-notifications-fhir-api
related_standards:
The following APIs also give access to the Personal Demographics Service:
* [Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir) - use this newer API to search for patients, retrieve patients by NHS number and update patients.
* [Personal Demographics Service - HL7 V3 API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-hl7-v3) - use this if you want to use functions that are not yet available on the FHIR API.

The following APIs are also related to this API:
* [Organisation Data Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-hl7-v3) - use this to get full details for the organisations related to the patient, such as their registered GP or nominated pharmacy.
* [Organisation Data Service - ORD API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/organisation-data-service-ord) - use this to access a searchable national repository of NHS Organisation Reference Data using an ORD interface.
title: Personal Demographics Service Notifications - FHIR API

description: Access patients' personal information, such as name, address, date of birth, related people, registered GP and NHS number using our Spine Mini Service Provider (SMSP) API.
name: personal-demographics-service-smsp-api
related_standards:
The following APIs also give access to the Personal Demographics Service:

Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API - use this newer API to search for patients, retrieve patients by NHS number and update patients.
Personal Demographics Service - HL7 V3 API - use this if you want to use functions that are not yet available on the FHIR API.
Personal Demographics Service - SMSP API - this API is now deprecated.
The following APIs are also related to these API standards:

Organisation Data Service - FHIR API - use this to get full details for the organisations related to the patient, such as their registered GP or nominated pharmacy.
Organisation Data Service - ORD API - use this to access a searchable national repository of NHS Organisation Reference Data using an ORD interface.
title: Personal Demographics Service - SMSP API

description: Access patients' personal information, such as name, address, date of birth, related people, registered GP and NHS number using our HL7 V3 version of the Personal Demographics Service (PDS) API.
name: personal-demographics-service-hl7-v3-api
related_standards:
The following APIs also give access to the Personal Demographics Service:

Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API - use this new API to search for patients, retrieve patients by NHS number and update patients.

Personal Demographics Service - SMSP API - this API is now deprecated.

The following APIs are also related to this API:

Organisation Data Service - FHIR API - use this to get full details for the organisations related to the patient, such as their registered GP or nominated pharmacy.

Other interactions may apply, more information on the API Catalogue
title: Personal Demographics Service - HL7 V3 API

description: Access patients' personal information, such as name, address, date of birth, related people, registered GP and NHS number using our FHIR version of the Personal Demographics Service (PDS) API.
name: personal-demographics-service-fhir-api
related_standards:
The following APIs also give access to the Personal Demographics Service:

Personal Demographics Service (SMSP) API - this API is now deprecated.
Personal Demographics Service (HL7 V3) API - use this if you want to use functions that are not yet available on the FHIR API.
Once our roadmap is complete, the above APIs will become redundant.

The following APIs are also related to this API:

Personal Demographics Service Notifications - FHIR API - use this to subscribe to be notified of a limited set of patient record changes, such as birth, death, change of address and change of GP. 
Organisation Data Service FHIR API - use this to get full details for the organisations related to the patient, such as their registered GP or nominated pharmacy.
title: Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API

description: An information standard to form the basis of sharing pathology test requests and results for all of England.
name: pathology-test-and-results-standard
related_standards:
This standard relates to:
* [SCCI0034 SNOMED CT](https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/information-standards/information-standards-and-data-collections-including-extractions/publications-and-notifications/standards-and-collections/scci0034-snomed-ct) - the clinical terminology standard to support direct management of care
* [EDIFACT ISB 1557](https://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20150107145848/http:/www.isb.nhs.uk/documents/isb-1557/amd-39-2003) - the current clinical message exchange standard for GP-Hospital Communications, including pathology information using variant NHS003
* [HL7 Version 2 (V2)](http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_brief.cfm?product_id=185) and [(V3) CDA (HL7 Clinical Document Architecture)](http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_brief.cfm?product_id=496) - the current message exchange (de-facto) standard across secondary care/middleware including pathology test results from Laboratory Information Management Systems
* [HL7 FHIR](http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_section.cfm?section=12) - the interoperability standard identified to facilitate the exchange of all healthcare information across the NHS in the future
* [The Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM)](https://ucum.org/trac) - the international standard for all units of measure being contemporarily used, including Healthcare
* [The NHS Pathology Bounded Code List](https://isd.digital.nhs.uk/trud3/user/guest/group/0/pack/38/subpack/23/releases) - used within the ISB 1557 EDIFACT for the Pathology domain which, along with the [NHS National Laboratory Medicine Catalogue](https://isd.digital.nhs.uk/trud3/user/guest/group/0/pack/25) are still released and were utilised to inform this specification
title: Pathology Test and Results Standard

related_standards:
This API relates to:
* [GP2GP - HL7 V3 API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/gp2gp) - use this API to transfer patients' electronic health records between old and new practices when they change GPs.
* [Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir) - use this new API to search for patients, retrieve patients by NHS number and update patients
* [Personal Demographics Service - HL7 V3 API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-hl7-v3) - use this if you want to use functions that are not yet available on the FHIR API
* [Personal Demographics Service - SMSP API](https://digital.nhs.uk/services/spine/spine-mini-service-provider-for-personal-demographics-service) - use this if you want to get PDS data without an authenticated end user (no [smartcard](https://digital.nhs.uk/services/registration-authorities-and-smartcards) required). It is, however, read-only and searches are limited to a single result
* [Messaging Exchange for Social care and Health (MESH)](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/message-exchange-for-social-care-and-health-api) - use this component of the Spine to deliver messages and files to registered recipients
title: National Health Application and Infrastructure Services - NHAIS GP Links API

related_standards:
At the time of publication APIs and specifications are available to support the following use cases:

description: Transfer patients' electronic health records, securely and quickly, between their old and new practices when they change GPs.

related_standards:
This standards relates to the following APIs:
* [Personal Demographics Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir) - use this new API to search for patients, retrieve patients by NHS number and update patients.
* [Personal Demographics Service - HL7 V3 APII](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-hl7-v3) - use this if you want to use functions that are not yet available on the FHIR API.
* [Personal Demographics Service - SMSP APII](https://digital.nhs.uk/services/spine/spine-mini-service-provider-for-personal-demographics-service) - use this if you want to get PDS data without an authenticated end user (no smartcard required). It is, however, read-only and searches are limited to a single result.
* [Spine Directory Service - LDAP APII](https://digital.nhs.uk/services/registration-authorities-and-smartcards) - use this to access data in the Spine using Directory Service (SDS), our LDAP API, which provides details of organisations, people and systems registered with the Spine.
* [NHAIS GP Links API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/nhais-gp-links) - use this to manage GP registrations and other patient data in NHAIS.
* [Organisation Data Service - FHIR/ORD APII](https://digital.nhs.uk/pagenotfound) - use this to search a national repository of NHS Organisation Reference Data using a FHIR or an ORD interface.
* [Messaging Exchange for Social care and Health (MESH)I](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/message-exchange-for-social-care-and-health-api) - use this component of the Spine to deliver messages and files to registered recipients, in this case, to send audit information.
title: GP2GP - HL7 V3 API

description: Track a patient’s prescriptions within the Electronic Prescription Service (EPS).
name: electronic-prescription-service-tracker-rest-api
related_standards:
The following endpoint of the Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) FHIR API is currently in development and also gives access to prescription tracking:

EPS FHIR API Tracker endpoint - use this to search for summary details about a prescription

The following APIs also give access to the EPS:

Electronic Prescription Service - FHIR API - access the Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) - currently you can only use this new API to prescribe, not dispense or tracking

Electronic Prescription Service - HL7 V3 API - use this if you want to use functions that are not yet available on the FHIR API

Signing Service - use this to digitally sign a prescription
title: Electronic Prescription Service Tracker - REST API

description: Access information about dispensing services, including searching for dispensers who can provide dispensing services for a patient with a given location and urgency, using our Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) Directory of Services (DoS) API.
name: electronic-prescription-service-directory-of-services-api
related_standards:
The following APIs are related to this API:

Electronic Prescription Service - FHIR API  - access the Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) - currently you can only use this new API to prescribe, not dispense.
Electronic Prescription Service - HL7 V3 API - access the Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) to send prescriptions from prescribers such as GPs to dispensers such as pharmacies using our HL7 V3 API.

Prescription Tracker API - use this if you want a read-only interface to obtain information about a patient’s prescriptions.
NHS BSA Prescription Services Open Data Portal - download public datasets including Secondary care medicines data (SCMD),  prescriptions issued in England, and Prescription Cost Analysis (PCA) in England.
Directory of Services API - retrieve information about a wide range of health and care services in England with the Directory of Service (DoS) API.
Electronic Transmission of Prescriptions (ETP) web services - access dispenser information for a patient via NHS UK Web Services.
title: Electronic Prescription Service Directory of Services API

description: Access the Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) to send prescriptions from prescribers such as GPs to dispensers such as pharmacies using our HL7 V3 API.

related_standards:

Electronic Prescription Service - FHIR API  - access the Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) - currently you can only use this new API to prescribe, not dispense or tracking
The following APIs are also related to this API:

Prescription Tracker API - use this if you want a read-only interface to obtain information about a patient’s prescriptions
Electronic Prescription Service (EPS) Directory of Services (DoS) API - use this to get information about dispensing services, including search for dispensers who can provide dispensing services for a patient with a given location and urgency
title: Electronic Prescription Service - HL7 V3 API
